get.summary: Get list of available Bitrise addons
get.description: List all the available Bitrise addons

get.summary: Get a specific Bitrise addon
get.description: Show details of a specific Bitrise addon

get.summary: Get list of the apps
get.description: List all the apps available for the authenticated account, including those that are owned by other users or Organizations.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Order of the applications: sort them based on when they were created or the time of their last build

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first app in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

parameters.name: project_type
parameters.description: The project type of the app (eg. 'ios', 'android')

post.summary: Add a new app
post.description: Add a new app to Bitrise. This is the first step of the app registration process. To successfully set it up, you need to provide the required app parameters: the repository URL and the isPublic field. Read more about the app creation process in our [detailed guide](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/adding-and-managing-apps/#adding-a-new-app).

get.summary: Get a specific app
get.description: Get the details of a specific app by providing the app slug. You can get the app slug by calling the [/apps](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/application/app-list) endpoint or by opening the app on bitrise.io and copying the slug from the URL.

delete.description: Deletes an app by slug. Use with care, make sure you really want to delete the app. This action cannot be undone.

patch.description: Updates an app by slug. Only updates the fields specified in the body.

requestBody.description: App update params. All fields are optional, omit the fields you don't wish to update.

get.summary: Get list of the addons for apps
get.description: List all the provisioned addons for the authorized apps

get.summary: Get a list of the android keystore files
get.description: List all the android keystore files that have been uploaded to a specific app.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first android keystore file in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of build certificates per page is 50.

post.summary: Create an Android keystore file
post.description: Add a new Android keystore file to an app. `keystore_file_name` is required if there is already an existing keystore file for the app. It will determine the environment variable key to be used to refer to the keystore file in builds. E.g. `BITRISE_ANDROID_KEYSTORE_<keystore_file_name>_URL`. The `keystore_file_name` can only contain letters, numbers, and underscores.

delete.description: Delete an app's android keystore file. You can fetch an app's android keystore file slug if you first list all the uploaded files with the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/android-keystore-files](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/android-keystore-file/android-keystore-file-list) endpoint. Read more in our [Deleting a file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-android-keystore-files.html) guide.

post.summary: Confirm an android keystore file upload
post.description: This is the last step of uploading an android keystore file to Bitrise. Confirm the android keystore file upload and view the file on the Code Signing tab of a specific app. Read more in our [Confirming the upload](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-files-in-generic-file-storage/#confirming-the-file-upload) guide.

get.summary: List 1000 archived builds of an app
get.description: List the first 1000 archived builds of a specified Bitrise app. Set parameters to filter builds:

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Listed builds should only be the ones which ran after the given date (Unix Timestamp)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Listed builds should only be the ones which ran before the given date (Unix Timestamp)

get.summary: Get bitrise.yml of a specific app
get.description: Get the full `bitrise.yml` configuration of an application, by providing the app slug. It returns the current `bitrise.yml` that is stored on bitrise.io in full, including the trigger map, the different workflows and the Steps.

post.summary: Upload a new bitrise.yml for your application.
post.description: Upload a new bitrise.yml for your application.

get.summary: Getting the location of the application's bitrise.yaml
get.description: Getting the location of the application's bitrise.yaml. Requires administrator level privileges to the app.

put.summary: Changing the location of the application's bitrise.yaml
put.description: Changing the location of the application's bitrise.yaml. Requires administrator level privileges to the app.

get.summary: List the branches with existing builds of an app's repository
get.description: Lists only those branches of a specified Bitrise app that have existing builds.

get.summary: Get a list of the build certificates
get.description: List all the build certificates that have been uploaded to a specific app. Read more in our [Listing the uploaded iOS code signing files of an app](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#listing-the-uploaded-ios-code-signing-files-of-an-app) guide.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first build certificate in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of build certificates per page is 50.

post.summary: Create a build certificate
post.description: Create a temporary pre-signed upload URL for the build certificate and upload the file to AWS with a simple `curl` request. To complete the uploading process and view your files on the Code Signing tab of your app, continue with the [POST /apps/{app-slug}/build-certificates/{build-certificate-slug}/uploaded](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-certificate/build-certificate-confirm) endpoint. Read more in our [Creating and uploading an iOS code signing file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#creating--uploading-an-ios-code-signing-file) guide.

requestBody.description: Build certificate parameters such as file name and its file size

get.summary: Get a specific build certificate
get.description: Retrieve data of a specific build certificate. You can fetch the build certificate slug for this endpoint if you first call the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/build-certificates](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-certificate/build-certificate-list) endpoint to list all available build certificates of an app. Read more in our [Getting a specific iOS code signing file's data](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#getting-a-specific-ios-code-signing-files-data) guide.

delete.description: Delete an app's build certificate. You can fetch the build certificate slug for this endpoint if you first call the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/build-certificates](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-certificate/build-certificate-list) endpoint to list all available build certificates of an app. Read more in our [Deleting an iOS code signing file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#deleting-an-ios-code-signing-file) guide.

patch.description: Update an uploaded build certificate's attributes. You can fetch the build certificate slug for this endpoint if you first call the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/build-certificates](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-certificate/build-certificate-list) endpoint. Read more in our [Updating an uploaded iOS code signing file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#confirming-the-ios-code-signing-file-upload) guide.

post.summary: Confirm a build certificate upload
post.description: This is the last step of uploading a build certificate to Bitrise. Confirm the build certificate upload and view the file on the Code Signing tab of a specific app. Read more in our [Confirming the iOS code signing file upload](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#confirming-the-ios-code-signing-file-upload) guide.

get.summary: List the open build requests for an app
get.description: List the existing open build requests of a specified Bitrise app

patch.description: Update a specific build request of a specific app

get.summary: List the workflows of an app
get.description: List the workflows that were triggered at any time for a given Bitrise app. Note that it might list workflows that are currently not defined in the app's `bitrise.yml` configuration - and conversely, workflows that were never triggered will not be listed even if they are defined in the `bitrise.yml` file.

get.summary: List all builds of an app
get.description: List all the builds of a specified Bitrise app. Set parameters to filter builds: for example, you can search for builds run with a given workflow or all builds that were triggered by Pull Requests. It returns all the relevant data of the build.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Order of builds: sort them based on when they were created or the time when they were triggered

parameters.name: workflow
parameters.description: The name of the workflow used for the build

parameters.name: commit_message
parameters.description: The commit message of the build

parameters.name: trigger_event_type
parameters.description: The event that triggered the build (push, pull-request, tag)

parameters.name: pull_request_id
parameters.description: The id of the pull request that triggered the build

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: List builds run after a given date (Unix Timestamp)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: List builds run before a given date (Unix Timestamp)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the build: not finished (0), successful (1), failed (2), aborted with failure (3), aborted with success (4)

parameters.name: is_pipeline_build
parameters.description: Whether the builds are part of a pipeline or not

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first build in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

post.summary: Trigger a new build/pipeline
post.description: Trigger a new build/pipeline. Specify an app slug and at least one parameter out of three: a git tag or git commit hash, a branch, or a workflow/pipeline ID. You can also set specific parameters for Pull Request builds/pipelines and define additional environment variables for your build/pipeline. [Check out our detailed guide](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/build-trigger/).

get.summary: Get a build of a given app
get.description: Get the specified build of a given Bitrise app. You need to provide both an app slug and a build slug. You can get the build slug either by calling the [/builds](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/builds/build-list) endpoint or by clicking on the build on bitrise.io and copying the slug from the URL. The endpoint returns all the relevant data of the build.

post.summary: Abort a specific build
post.description: Abort a specific build. Set an abort reason with the `abort_reason` parameter. Use the `abort_with_success` parameter to abort a build but still count it as a successful one.

get.summary: Get a list of all build artifacts
get.description: List all build artifacts that have been generated for an app's build. This endpoint can retrieve artifacts from the archive as well. You can use the created build artifact slugs from the response output to retrieve data of a specific build artifact with the [GET/apps/](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-artifact/artifact-show) endpoint or update a build artifact with the [PATCH/apps](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-artifact/artifact-update) endpoint.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first build artifact in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of build artifacts per page is 50.

get.summary: Get a specific build artifact
get.description: Retrieve data of a specific build artifact. The endpoint can retrieve archived artifacts as well. The response output contains a time-limited download url (expires in 10 minutes) and a public install-page URL. You can view the build artifact with both URLs, but the public install-page url will not work unless you [enable it](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/tutorials/deploy/bitrise-app-deployment/#enabling-public-page-for-the-app).

parameters.name: download
parameters.description: Setting this will result in a redirect to the artifact download location

delete.description: Delete a build artifact of an app's build. The required parameters are app slug, build slug and artifact slug. You can fetch the build artifact slug if you first list all build artifacts of an app with the [/apps/](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-artifact/artifact-list) endpoint.

patch.description: Update the `is_public_page_enabled` attribute of your app's build. The required parameters are app slug, build slug and artifact slug. You can fetch the build artifact slug if you first list all build artifacts of an app with the [GET /apps/](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/build-artifact/artifact-list) endpoint.

get.summary: Get the bitrise.yml of a build
get.description: Get the bitrise.yml file of one of the builds of a given app. This will return the `bitrise.yml` configuration with which the build ran. You can compare it to [the current bitrise.yml configuration](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/application/app-config-datastore-show) of the app.

get.summary: Get the build log of a build
get.description: Get the build log of a specified build of a Bitrise app. You can get the build slug either by calling the [/builds](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/builds/build-list) endpoint or by clicking on the build on bitrise.io and copying the slug from the URL. Preview of the log is returned in `log_chunks` field in JSON format. You can download the full raw log in txt by using the signed url returned in `expiring_raw_log_url`. Be aware that this url is expiring in 10 minutes!

get.summary: List the key-value cache items belonging to an app
get.description: List all the available cache items that the builds of the app created via the save-cache step.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Getting cache items created before the given parameter (RFC3339 time format, default: now)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 100)

delete.summary: Deletes all key-value cache items belonging to an app
delete.description: Deletes all key-value cache items created by the builds of an app. Deleted cache items are no longer accessible and cannot be restored.
Deletes a key-value cache item. Deleted cache items are no longer accessible and cannot be restored.

parameters.name: cache-item-id
parameters.description: The ID of the cache item to be deleted

get.summary: Gets the download URL of a key-value cache item
get.description: Gets a download URL of a cache item.

parameters.name: cache-item-id
parameters.description: The ID of the cache item to be downloaded

post.summary: Save the application at the end of the app registration process
post.description: Save the application after registering it on Bitrise and registering an SSH key (and, optionally, adding a webhook). With this endpoint you can define the initial configuration, define application-level environment variables, determine the project type, and set an Organization to be the owner of the app. Read more about the app registration process in our [detailed guide](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/adding-and-managing-apps/#adding-a-new-app).

get.summary: Get a list of the generic project files
get.description: List all the generic project files that have been uploaded to a specific app. Read more in our [Listing the uploaded files of an app](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-files-in-generic-file-storage/#listing-the-uploaded-files-of-an-app) guide.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first generic project file in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of build certificates per page is 50.

post.summary: Create a generic project file
post.description: Create a temporary pre-signed upload URL (expires in 10 minutes) for the generic project file and upload it to AWS with a simple `curl` request. To complete the uploading process and view your files on the Code Signing tab of your app, continue with the [POST /apps/{app-slug}/generic-project-files/{generic-project-file-slug}/uploaded](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/generic-project-file/generic-project-file-confirm) endpoint. Read more in our [Creating and uploading files to Generic File Storage](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-files-in-generic-file-storage/#creating-and-uploading-files-to-generic-file-storage) guide.

get.summary: Get a specific generic project file
get.description: Retrieve data of a specific generic project file to check its attributes and optionally modify them with the [PATCH /apps/](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/generic-project-file/generic-project-file-update) endpoint. Read more in our [Retrieving a specific file's data](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-files-in-generic-file-storage/#retrieving-a-specific-files-data) guide.

delete.description: Delete an app's generic project file. You can fetch an app's generic project file slug if you first list all the uploaded files with the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/generic-project-files](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/generic-project-file/generic-project-file-list) endpoint. Read more in our [Deleting a file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-files-in-generic-file-storage/#deleting-a-file) guide.

patch.description: Update a generic project file's attributes. You can fetch an app's generic project file slug if you first list all the uploaded files with the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/generic-project-files](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/generic-project-file/generic-project-file-list) endpoint. Read more in our [Updating an uploaded file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-files-in-generic-file-storage/#updating-an-uploaded-file) guide.

post.summary: Confirm a generic project file upload
post.description: This is the last step of uploading a generic project file to Bitrise. Confirm the generic project file upload and view the file on the Code Signing tab of a specific app. Read more in our [Confirming the upload](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-files-in-generic-file-storage/#confirming-the-file-upload) guide.

get.summary: List the outgoing webhooks of an app
get.description: List all the outgoing webhooks registered for a specified Bitrise app. This returns all the relevant data of the webhook, including the slug of the webhook and its URL.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first webhook in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

post.summary: Create an outgoing webhook for an app
post.description: Create an outgoing webhook for a specified Bitrise app: this can be used to send build events to a specified URL with custom headers. Currently, only build events can trigger outgoing webhooks.

put.summary: Update an outgoing webhook of an app
put.description: Update an existing outgoing webhook (URL, events, secrets and headers) for a specified Bitrise app. Even if you do not want to change one of the parameters, you still have to provide that parameter as well: simply use its existing value.

delete.summary: Delete an outgoing webhook of an app
delete.description: Delete an existing outgoing webhook for a specified Bitrise app.

get.summary: List the webhook delivery items of an app
get.description: List all the delivery items of an outgoing webhook of a Bitrise application

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first delivery item in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

get.summary: Get a specific delivery item of a webhook
get.description: Get the specified delivery item of an outgoing webhook of a Bitrise application

post.summary: Re-deliver the webhook delivery items of an app
post.description: Re-deliver the delivery item of a specified webhook of a Bitrise application

get.summary: List all pipelines and standalone builds of an app
get.description: List all the pipelines and standalone builds of a specified Bitrise app. Set parameters to filter pipelines: for example, you can search for pipelines/standalone builds run with a given workflow name or all pipelines/standalone builds that were triggered by Pull Requests. It returns all the relevant data of the pipelines/standalone builds.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: List pipelines/standalone builds run after a given date (RFC3339 time format)

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: List pipelines/standalone builds run before a given date (RFC3339 time format) - was called 'next' earlier

parameters.name: commit_message
parameters.description: The commit message of the pipeline/standalone build

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page - default: 10

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: List pipelines/standalone builds run before a given date (RFC3339 time format) - deprecated

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the pipeline/standalone build: on_hold, running, succeeded, failed, aborted, succeeded_with_abort

parameters.name: trigger_event_type
parameters.description: The event that triggered the pipeline/standalone build (push, pull-request, tag)

parameters.name: workflow
parameters.description: The name of the workflow used for the pipeline/standalone build

get.summary: Get a pipeline of a given app
get.description: Get the specified pipeline of a given Bitrise app. You need to provide both an app slug and a pipeline id. You can get the pipeline id either by calling the [/pipelines](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/pipelines/pipeline-list) endpoint or by clicking on the pipeline on bitrise.io and copying the id from the URL. The endpoint returns all the relevant data of the pipeline.

post.summary: Aborts a pipeline
post.description: Aborts a pipeline. You need to provide the app slug and the id of the pipeline. You can add an abort reason, choose to skip notifications and make the abort with success state.

post.summary: Rebuilds a pipeline
post.description: Rebuilds a pipeline. You can rebuild the whole pipeline or only the unsuccessful and subsequent workflows by setting the partial flag to true.

get.summary: Get a list of the provisioning profiles
get.description: List all the provisioning profiles that have been uploaded to a specific app. Read more in our [Listing the uploaded iOS code signing files of an app](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#listing-the-uploaded-ios-code-signing-files-of-an-app) guide.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first provisioning profile in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

post.summary: Create a provisioning profile
post.description: Create a temporary pre-signed upload URL (expires in 10 minutes) for the provisioning profile and upload it to AWS with a simple `curl` request. To complete the upload process, continue with the [POST /apps/{app-slug}/provisioning-profiles/{provisioning-profile-slug}/uploaded](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/provisioning-profile/provisioning-profile-confirm) endpoint. Read more in our [Creating and uploading an iOS code signing file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#creating--uploading-an-ios-code-signing-file) guide.

requestBody.description: Provisioning profile parameters such as file name and file size

get.summary: Get a specific provisioning profile
get.description: Retrieve data of a specific provisioning profile. You can fetch the provisioning profile's slug if you call the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/provisioning-profiles](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/provisioning-profile/provisioning-profile-list) endpoint. Read more in our [Getting a specific iOS code signing file's data](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#getting-a-specific-ios-code-signing-files-data) guide.

delete.description: Delete an app's provisioning profile. You can fetch the provisioning profile's slug if you call the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/provisioning-profiles](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/provisioning-profile/provisioning-profile-list) endpoint. Read more in our [Deleting an iOS code signing file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#deleting-an-ios-code-signing-file) guide.

patch.description: Update an uploaded provisioning profile's attributes. You can fetch the provisioning profile's slug if you call the [GET /apps/{app-slug}/provisioning-profiles](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/provisioning-profile/provisioning-profile-list) endpoint. Read more in our [Updating an uploaded iOS code signing file](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#confirming-the-ios-code-signing-file-upload) guide.

post.summary: Confirm a provisioning profile upload
post.description: This is the last step of the upload process. Confirm the provisioning profile upload and view the file on the Code Signing tab of a specific app. Read more in our [Confirming the iOS code signing file upload](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/managing-ios-code-signing-files/#confirming-the-ios-code-signing-file-upload) guide.

post.summary: Add an SSH-key to a specific app
post.description: Add an SSH-key to a specific app. After creating an app, you need to register the SSH key so that Bitrise will be able to access and clone your repository during the build process. This requires the app slug of your newly created app.

post.summary: Register an incoming webhook for a specific application
post.description: [Register an incoming webhook](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/api/incoming-and-outgoing-webhooks/#incoming-webhooks) for a specific application. You can do this during the app registration process or at any other time in an app's life. When calling this endpoint, a webhook is registered at your git provider: this is necessary to automatically trigger builds on Bitrise.

post.summary: Create a new Apple App Store release for the app.
post.description: Create a new iOS release for the specified app. If the release candidate parameters (`release_branch` and `workflow`) are specified then the latest successful build is automatically picked up as release candidate and if `automatic_testflight_upload` is also turned on, then an upload to TestFlight is started immediately. You can use this endpoint to set up a fully automated release flow.

post.summary: Create a new Google Play Store release for the app.
post.description: Create a new android release for the specified app. If the release candidate parameters (`release_branch` and `workflow`) are specified then the latest successful build is automatically picked up as release candidate and if `automatic_play_console_upload` is also turned on, then an upload to Google Play Console is started immediately. You can use this endpoint to set up a fully automated release flow.

get.summary: Lists group roles for an app

parameters.name: role-name
parameters.description: Name of the role being queried, supported values are: admin, manager (equals developer), and member (equals tester/qa)

put.summary: Replaces group roles for an app
put.description: Replaces the groups for a given role on an app. Only the given groups will be present for a role on the app after this call.

parameters.name: role-name
parameters.description: Name of the role being modified, supported values are: admin, manager (equals developer), and member (equals tester/qa)

get.summary: List the application secrets (with no values)
get.description: List the application secrets (with no values). Requires administrator level privileges to the app.

put.description: Upsert an application secret. Requires administrator level privileges to the app.

delete.description: Delete an application secret. Requires administrator level privileges to the app.

get.summary: Get the value of an (unprotected) application secrets
get.description: Get the value of an (unprotected) application secrets. Requires administrator level privileges to the app.

get.summary: List the test devices for an app
get.description: List registered test devices of all members of a specified Bitrise app

patch.description: Updates the app's email notification settings with parameters

get.summary: List all builds
get.description: List all the Bitrise builds that can be accessed with the authenticated account. Filter builds based on their owner, using the owner slug, or the status of the build.

parameters.name: owner_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the owner of the app or apps

parameters.name: is_on_hold
parameters.description: Indicates whether the build has started yet (true: the build hasn't started)

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the build: not finished (0), successful (1), failed (2), aborted with failure (3), aborted with success (4)

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first build in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

post.summary: Add a member to a group
post.description: Add a member to a group

get.summary: Get your profile info
get.description: Shows the authenticated users profile info

get.summary: Get list of Bitrise activity events
get.description: List all the Bitrise activity events

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first activity event in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

get.summary: The subscription plan of the user
get.description: Get the subscription of the user: the current plan, any pending plans, and the duration of a trial period if applicable

get.summary: List the organizations that the user is part of
get.description: List all Bitrise organizations that the user is part of

get.summary: Get a specified organization.
get.description: Get a specified Bitrise organization that the user is part of.

get.summary: Get list of the apps for an organization
get.description: List all the available apps owned by a given organization. [Find the organization URL](https://devcenter.bitrise.io/team-management/organizations/org-url/) of the organisations you are part of; be aware that the endpoint will not return any apps if the authenticated account is not a member of the given organisation.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Order of applications: sort them based on when they were created or the time of their last build

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first app in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

parameters.name: project_type
parameters.description: The project type of the app (eg. 'ios', 'android')

patch.description: Migrates all apps' machine types of an organization from one machine type to another

requestBody.description: Machine type to migrate from and to

get.summary: List organizations groups
get.description: Lists the groups of an organization

post.summary: Adds a group to the organization
post.description: Adds a group to the organization

get.summary: List the members of the organization

get.description: Get the secrets of an organization

get.summary: Get a single secret by name
get.description: Get a single secret by name, including the value if not protected

patch.description: Update an existing secret. If the secret is protected, only its value can be overridden.

get.summary: Get list of the addons for organization
get.description: List all the provisioned addons for organization

get.summary: List all pipelines/standalone builds
get.description: List all the Bitrise pipelines/standalone builds that can be accessed with the authenticated account. Filter pipelines/standalone builds based on their owner, using the owner slug, or the status of the pipeline/standalone build.

parameters.name: owner_slug
parameters.description: The slug of the owner of the app or apps

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status of the pipelines/standalone build: on_hold, running, succeeded, failed, aborted, succeeded_with_abort

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Getting pipelines/standalone builds before the given parameter (RFC3339 time format)

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 10)

patch.description: Migrates all apps' machine types of a user from one machine type to another

requestBody.description: Machine type to migrate from and to

get.summary: Get a specific user
get.description: Show information about a specific user

get.summary: Get list of the addons for user
get.description: List all the provisioned addons for the authenticated user

get.summary: List Apple API credentials for a specific user
get.description: List Apple API credentials for a specific Bitrise user

get.summary: Get list of the apps for a user
get.description: List all the available apps for the given user.  It needs the user slug that you can get from the [GET /me](https://api-docs.bitrise.io/#/user/user-profile) endpoint.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Slug of the first app in the response

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Max number of elements per page (default: 50)

parameters.name: project_type
parameters.description: The project type of the app (eg. 'ios', 'android')

app_config_datastore_yaml.description: The bitrise.yml of your application, defined in JSON format

config.description: Which config to use. Specify a config that matches your project type (e. g. `default-android-config` for `android`, etc.). If not speficied, default value is `other-config`. The available values are `default-android-config`, `default-cordova-config`, `default-fastlane-android-config`, `default-fastlane-ios-config`, `flutter-config-notest-app-android`, `flutter-config-notest-app-both`, `flutter-config-notest-app-ios`, `flutter-config-test-app-android`, `flutter-config-test-app-both`, `flutter-config-test-app-ios`, `default-ionic-config`, `default-ios-config`, `default-macos-config`, `default-react-native-config`, `default-react-native-expo-config`, `other-config`.

envs.description: Environment variables for the application workflows, e.g. {"env1":"val1","env2":"val2"}

mode.description: config specification mode, has to be specified with `manual` value

organization_slug.description: The slug of the organization, who will be the owner of the application, if it's not specified, then the authenticated user will be the owner

project_type.description: The type of your project (`android`, `ios`, `cordova`, `other`, `xamarin`, `macos`, `ionic`, `react-native`, `fastlane`, null)

stack_id.description: The id of the stack the application will be built (these can be found in the [system report](https://github.com/bitrise-io/bitrise.io/tree/master/system_reports) file names)

on_failure.description: When should Bitrise send notifications for the users on build failure? Possible values: always, never, change

on_success.description: When should Bitrise send notifications for the users on build success? Possible values: always, never, change

scope.description: Scope of the secret (workspace or app or nothing)

apple_credential_user_id.description: The new apple credential user ID (recommendation: use the UI to set this)

apple_credential_user_slug.description: The new apple credential user slug (recommendation: use the UI to set this)

default_branch.description: The new default branch for the application.

is_public.description: The new value of whether an application should be publicly visible

repository_url.description: The new repository URL for the application.

services_credential_user_id.description: The new service credential user ID (recommendation: use the UI to set this)

title.description: The new title of the application.

default_branch_name.description: The default branch of the repository. If it's not specified, it will be `master`.

git_owner.description: [Deprecated] You no longer need to provide this field.

git_repo_slug.description: [Deprecated] You no longer need to provide this field.

is_public.description: If `true` then the repository visibility setting will be public, in case of `false` it will be private

manual_approval_enabled.description: Toggles whether manual approval should be enabled for the app's builds. If it's not specified, it will be `true`.

organization_slug.description: The slug of the organization, who will be the owner of the application. If it's not specified, then the authenticated user will be the owner.

provider.description: The git provider you are using, it can be `github`, `bitbucket`, `gitlab`, `gitlab-self-hosted` or `custom`

title.description: The title of the application. If it's not specified, it will be the git repository's name.

type.description: [Deprecated] You no longer need to provide this field.

location.description: Location of bitrise.yml file. Enums(bitrise.io, repository)
Location of bitrise.yml file. Enums(bitrise.io, repository)

build_params.description: The public part of the SSH key you would like to use

app.description: The apps which had an error's identifiers in the following format "#{app.title} (#{app.slug})"

migrated_apps.description: The migrated apps' identifiers in the following format "#{app.title} (#{app.slug})"

next.description:
Next is the "anchor" for pagination. This value should be passed to the same endpoint
to get the next page. Empty/not included if there's no "next" page.
Stop paging when there's no "Next" item in the response!

page_item_limit.description:
PageItemLimit - per-page item count. A given page might include
less items if there's not enough items. This value is the "max item count per page".

total_item_count.description: TotalItemCount - total item count, through "all pages"

automatic_testflight_upload.description: @Deprecated use `automatic_store_upload` instead. Indicates whether or not to upload every release candidate build automatically to TestFlight (default: `false`)

bundle_id.description: The bundle ID of the app to be released

description.description: An internal description of the release; it won't be propagated to the App Store (default: empty)

release_branch.description: The branch used for building the release candidate (default: empty)

slack_webhook_url.description: The Slack webhook URL to use for sending Slack notifications (default: empty)

teams_webhook_url.description: The Teams webhook URL to use for sending MS Teams notifications (default: empty)

workflow.description: The workflow used for building the release candidate (default: empty)

bundle_id.description: The bundle ID of the app

id.description: The ID of the newly created release

status.description: The status of the newly created release (`scheduled` or `in-progress`, depending on whether or not the release candidate settings were specified)

automatic_play_console_upload.description: Indicates whether or not to upload every release candidate build automatically to the Google Play Console (default: `false`)

description.description: An internal description of the release; it won't be propagated to the App Store (default: empty)

package_name.description: The package name of the app to be released

release_branch.description: The branch used for building the release candidate (default: empty)

slack_webhook_url.description: The Slack webhook URL to use for sending Slack notifications (default: empty)

teams_webhook_url.description: The Teams webhook URL to use for sending MS Teams notifications (default: empty)

workflow.description: The workflow used for building the release candidate (default: empty)

id.description: The ID of the newly created release

package_name.description: The package name of the app

status.description: The status of the newly created release (`scheduled` or `in-progress`, depending on whether or not the release candidate settings were specified)

auth_ssh_private_key.description: The private part of the SSH key you would like to use

auth_ssh_public_key.description: The public part of the SSH key you would like to use

is_register_key_into_provider_service.description: If it's set to true, the provided SSH key will be registered at the provider of the application
